sentence.Network_en: the halcyon days of her youth
sentence.Network_cn: 她年轻时幸福安宁的日子

sentence.Network_en: It was all a far cry from those halcyon days in 1990, when he won three tournaments on the European tour.
sentence.Network_cn: 这和1990年的那些美好时光大不相同，当时他在欧洲巡回赛中赢得了3场锦标赛。

sentence.Network_en: Those were the halcyon days of Athens ( fifth century BC ) when she produced her finest poetry and drama, architecture and sculpture.
sentence.Network_cn: 公元5世纪为雅典的太平盛世.雅典最优秀的诗歌、戏剧 、 建筑和雕刻均产生于这一时期.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the mythological sense): via Latin from Greek alkuōn 'kingfisher' (also halkuōn, by association with hals 'sea' and kuōn 'conceiving')

entry.tran: （旧日时光）美好的，安宁幸福的
entry.def: A halcyon time is a time in the past that was peaceful or happy.

example.ex: It was all a far cry from those halcyon days in 1990, when he won three tournaments on the European tour.
example.tran: 这和1990年的那些美好时光大不相同，当时他在欧洲巡回赛中赢得了3场锦标赛。

means.word_mean: 1. a mythical bird said to breed at the time of the winter solstice in a nest floating on the sea and to have the power of calming the winds and waves
1. idyllically calm and peaceful; suggesting happy tranquillity;

sentences.sentence: "the halcyon days of the clipper trade"

sentences.en: Those were the halcyon days of Athens (fifth century BC) when she produced her finest poetry and drama, architecture and sculpture.
sentences.cn: 公元5世纪为雅典的太平盛世。雅典最优秀的诗歌、戏剧、建筑和雕刻均产生于这一时期。
